result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Michael Froemel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

miscConds.notes: $243.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan Michael Froemel in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Defendant Ryan Michael Froemel in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Revocation order & warrant received and in file. State makes statement/recommendation, Victim rights have been complied with per DA,  Atty Yohnk makes statement/recommendation,  DE makes statement.  
Court sentences- maximum penalty-  90 days county jail on both cases 15CM163 & 15CM405 running concurrent, with Huber- hours and time to be determined by sheriff.  Credit of 44 days for time served.
Financial obligations that were previous conditions of probation to be reduced to a civil judgment  and tax intercept payable to the Clerk of Court's office.  DE remanded back to custody.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan Michael Froemel in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State plea reached and 15 CM 405 assigned to Judge Yackel.   State recites plea: 15 CM 163 - amend to disorderly conduct /NC plea - 1 yr probation - costs / 15 CM 362 dismiss  / 15 CM 405 - nc plea to count 2 - count 1 dismiss and read-in / 1 yr probation - costs and concurrent to 15 CM 163.  Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.  Court grants motion to amend 15 CM 163.   Defendant entered plea of no contest to 15 CM 163 as amended and 15 CM 405 count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty of 15 CM 163 and count 2 in 15 CM 405 and count 1 is dismissed and read-in.  15 CM 362 is dismissed.  State argues sentencing.  Atty yohnk argues sentencing.

COURT:  
15 CM 405: Sentence w/held probation 1 year - costs  - concurrent to 15 CM 163 - any counseling that may be recommended

Defendant Ryan Michael Froemel in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk appeared by phone.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   SIBS $500  No Special Conditions    Attorney Yohnk stated this is case is part of a plea agreement with cases (15CM163 & 15CM362) scheduled for Thursday 11/19/15 with Judge John Anderson.  Judge Yackel gives to Judge Anderson on general assignment   Scheduling conference scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.
